revision.text:
'''Wyncie King''' (1884–1961 [[Athens]]) was an American illustrator, cartoonist, and caricaturist.
==Life== He was an illustrator for the ''Louisville Courier-Journal'' and the ''Louisville Herald''. He married [[Hortense Flexner]] (1885–1973).
They moved to [[Philadelphia]]. He was a contributor to the ''[[Saturday Evening Post]]''. She taught at [[Bryn Mawr College|Bryn Mawr]], from 1926 to 1940, and at [[Sarah Lawrence College]] from 1942 to 1950.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slc.edu/magazine/money/fromthearchives.php |title=Sarah Lawrence Magazine: The Value of Money |publisher=Slc.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> They were friends of [[Susan Clay Sawitzky]],<ref>{{cite book| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dbLRU_0bt0kC&pg=PA184&dq=Wyncie+King&hl=en&ei=VPIlTrGkHOi10AHm0dm2Cg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CDoQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=Wyncie%20King&f=false| title=Cautious rebel: a biography of Susan Clay Sawitzky | author= Lindsey Apple| publisher= Kent State University Press| year= 1997| isbn= 978-0-87338-579-4}}</ref> and [[Martha Gellhorn]].<ref>{{cite book| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=83DHziZQZ_gC&pg=PA292&dq=Wyncie+King&hl=en&ei=VPIlTrGkHOi10AHm0dm2Cg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=9&ved=0CFEQ6AEwCA#v=onepage&q=Wyncie%20King&f=false| title=Gellhorn: A Twentieth-Century Life | author= Caroline Moorehead| publisher= Macmillan| year= 2004 | isbn= 978-0-8050-7696-7}}</ref>
His work is held at the [[Art Institute of Chicago]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.artic.edu/aic/collections/artwork/artist/105 |title=Wyncie King | The Art Institute of Chicago |publisher=Artic.edu |date=2011-08-06 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref>
His watercolors are held at [[The Filson Historical Society]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.filsonhistorical.org/archive/news_v6n2_king.html |title=The Filson Newsmagazine - Volume 6, Number 2 - Wyncie King |publisher=Filsonhistorical.org |date=1958-08-11 |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> His papers are held at the [[Archives of American Art]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Archives of American Art |url=http://www.aaa.si.edu/collections/wyncie-king-papers-7733 |title=Summary of the Wyncie King papers, [ca. 1940-1950] | Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution |publisher=Aaa.si.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref> Her papers are held at the [[University of Louisville]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://louisville.edu/library/archives/findingaids/flexner.html |title=Hortense Flexner (King) Papers—University of Louisville |publisher=Louisville.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref>
They are buried at the [[Sutton Island]] cemetery.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maine.gov/tools/whatsnew/index.php?topic=LibMeWriters&id=94810&v=Article2 |title=Maine Writers: Maine State Library |publisher=Maine.gov |date= |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cranberryisles.com/sutton.html#report |title=The Cemetery on Sutton Island - Copyright © 2001 Bruce Komusin |publisher=Cranberryisles.com |date= |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref>
==Bibliography== * Hortense Flexner, ''Chipper'', Frederick A. Stokes, 1941 * Hortense Flexner, ''Wishing Window'', (1942) * Hortense Flexner, ''Puzzle Pond'', (1948)
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://pages.slc.edu/~archives/exhibits/making_faces/01.php "Making Faces"], ''Sarah Lawrence College archives'' * {{cite book| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pXbYITw4ZesC&pg=PA484&lpg=PA484&dq=Wyncie+King&source=bl&ots=byw6qKPjVc&sig=Hvp5uEBhz716HGxpEGKn8EGDBvc&hl=en&ei=-eolToOoEebz0gHOubHZCg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=7&ved=0CEAQ6AEwBjgU#v=onepage&q=Wyncie%20King&f=false| title= The encyclopedia of Louisville | editor= John E. Kleber| publisher=University Press of Kentucky| year= 2001| isbn= 978-0-8131-2100-0}}
